page.title: 02Cider Making
page.content: Cider apples grow in an orchard They have 30 or 40 trees in them. We pick the apples off the trees and somebody goes up in the loft and puts the apples though the grinder and they come out of the pipe into the barrel. When it comes out of the bottom it is white mush. All the white crushed apple goes into the presser. We wrap up the crushed apple in some cloth and let the presser down. We turn a handle to put the presser down. We squash it really hard and the apple juice comes out of the bottom through the pipe into the barrels.It stays in the barrels until it is ready to drink. In the old days they used to wrap the crushed apple up in straw instead of cloth.The packets of crushed apple are called cheeses.
